section.title: System requirements
section.para: &MiKTeX25; will run on all &Windows; variants with the exception of &Windows95;.

section.title: Fixed bugs
section.para: Numerous bugs have been fixed in &MiKTeX25;. In order to see the complete list of fixed bugs:

section.title: miktex.ini splitted
section.para: miktex.ini has been splitted into several application-specific configuration files. For example, &Yap; configuration settings are now contained in yap.ini.

section.title: Installation directory
section.para: The new installation default is C:\Program Files\MiKTeX 2.5.

section.title: Local &TEXMF; directory
section.para: The semantics of the local &TEXMF; directory have changed: this directory will not be used anymore by &MiKTeX; to store auto-generated files. As for &MiKTeX;, the local &TEXMF; directory is now an ordinary &TEXMF; directory.

section.title: Data directory
section.para: Auto-generated files (e.g. format files) will now be stored in the &MiKTeX; data directory. The default location of this directory depends on the kind of the &MiKTeX; installation:

section.title: Paper size
section.para: In &MiKTeXOptions; it is now possible to set the preferred paper size for all applications (&Dvips;, &pdfTeX;, &Dvipdfm;). The setup wizard offers to choose between A4 and Letter.

section.title: Format files
section.para: The plain format files have been renamed:
The &MiKTeXOptions; utility now makes it possible to manage format files for &METAFONT; and &MetaPost;.

section.title: Registry
section.para: &MiKTeX; registry settings have been rearranged in order to support side-by-side installations. This shouldn't be an issue, since &MiKTeX; registry settings were undocumented in the past.

section.title: &MiKTeX; Registry Root Key
section.para: The &MiKTeX; Registry root ket has been changed from SOFTWARE\MiK\MiKTeX\CurrentVersion to SOFTWARE\MiKTeX.org\MiKTeX\2.5.

section.title: &MiKTeX; Registry Values
section.para: Various &MiKTeX; registry values have been renamed.

section.title: &Dvips;
section.para: &Dvips; has been upgraded to version 5.95b.

section.title: &Dvipdfmx;
section.para: &Dvipdfmx; has been upgraded to version 20051229.

section.title: &Dvipng;
section.para: &Dvipng; has been upgraded to version 1.8.

section.title: tex4ht
section.para: tex4ht has been upgraded to version 1.0.2006_05_06_0156.

section.title: &pdfeTeX;
section.para: &pdfeTeX; has been upgraded to version 1.30.6.
&pdfeTeX; is now the default engine, also for &DVI; output.

section.title: &pdfopen; / &pdfclose;
section.para: &pdfopen; and &pdfclose; can be used to control &AdobeReader;. The original author is Fabrice Popineau who wrote these utilities a long time ago for the &TeXLive; distribution.

section.title: &epstopdf;
section.para: The following options have been added:
section.variablelist:
--antialias
Enable anti-aliasing of bitmaps.
--enlarge=n
Enlarge bounding box by n &PostScript; points..
--gsopt=options
Add options the the &Ghostscript; command-line.
--pdf-version=ver
Set the &PDF; version.
--print-only
Print what would be done.
&optiontrace; --verbose
Turn on verbose output mode.

section.title: &mpm;
section.para: The following options have been added to the command-line version of the package manager:
section.variablelist:
--list-repositories
Download the list of known package repository URLs from the &MiKTeX; project server, then print the list.
--pick-repository-url
Pick up a suitable URL from the package repository list and print it.
&optionquiet;
--repository=location
Use the specified location as the package repository. The location can be either a fully qualified path name (a local package repository) or an URL (a remote package repository). You can use the --list-repositories to retrieve a list of working package repository URLs.
--set-repository=location
--set-repository=location
This option is only available on Windows systems: permanently register the location of the default package repository. The location can be either a fully qualified path name (a local package repository) or an URL (a remote package repository). Setting the environment variable MIKTEX_REPOSITORY has the same effect.
&optiontrace;

section.title: &mthelp;
section.para: &mthelp; is a utility to lookup &TeX; package documentation.
&mthelp; creates an &HTML; page which contains a short description of the package together with links to all documentation files. An &HTML; viewer is started to view the page.

section.title: &MiKTeXUpdateWizard;
section.para: The user interface has been improved to allow a faster (less mouse-clicks) run:

listitem.para: The welcome page can be skipped.
The last used update source is offered as the default (see )

section.title: &PostScript;
section.para: Support for &PostScript; has been improved significantly. For example, in the past &Yap; refused to display rotated text. This is not a problem anymore (see ).
The motto is:

para.emphasis: Every &DVI; document that can be viewed with a &PostScript; viewer (after &DVI;-to-&PostScript; conversion) can be viewed with &Yap;.

section.title: Ruler Tool
section.para: The new ruler tool can be used to measure distances on a document page (see ).

section.title: Command-Lines for Inverse &DVI; Search
section.para: It is now possible to configure more that one command-line for inverse search. The Inverse Search property page () allows you to associate a command-line with an editor name ().
